DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to compare - the non invasive measurement of arterial pressure (CNAP monitor) - with the invasive measurement of arterial pressure (radial artery catheter) during induction and maintenance of general anesthesia
DOC.criteria: Age >18 ASA II, III or IV weight between 40 and 180 kg; BMI < 35 surgical procedure performed in supine position normal Allen's test and hand Doppler examination. cardiac arrhythmias, history of vascular surgery or vascular implant in the upper limb
